instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> SSD issue after a drink
threads.message:
Hi, I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that has been given a little drink at the side of the keyboard right where the SSD chip is.

Turns on but doesn?t see the SSD

I took the board out and cleaned the small amount of crap near the SSD.

Put the board back in and checked it.
Now it sees the SSD, boots and runs perfectly... until you take the charger out.
With the charger is in, it sees the SSD, if it?s running on the battery only, it doesn?t see it.

Any ideas?

I?m not with the Mac right now and haven?t got a schematic, so I haven?t got voltages just yet.
just wondered if anyone had seen this type of fault before as it seems very likely given the position of the SSD.

Im assuming there?s separate power feeds to the SSD depending on charger or battery.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> SSD issue after a drink
threads.message:
All the power rails come from the same <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, or 3V3/5V rails; which are the same on battery, or charger mode.
Your issue should be related with some specific signal.
Take the board out and post the 820-xxxx code.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> SSD issue after a drink
threads.message: Thanks for the reply 2informaticos. It?s an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A unfortunately as I believe that?s the first of no schematic territory :(

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> SSD issue after a drink
threads.message: Looking at the area again.. it looks like a capacitor is half dead on one side.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> SSD issue after a drink
threads.message:
Check if 00239 schematic helps.
Compare diode mode readings between all the cap filters of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
You may need to change the cap and the chip in that corroded area.
